text:
Mr. John M. Parsey
February 4, 1958
Pago 2..
check then. The practitioner# will not. Even if they did,
they would not have the background to truly evaluate their
worth. Aa 1 say, this Is tough. The analysts nust know
their business. Also, one does not stake many friends this
way among those whose studies you are reviewing. On the other
hand, if this is not done, the value of the Inventory Is
severely limited. This wes the major fault with Kunata's
initial inventory of Instructional television research.
Again, let me apologise for the delay In responding
to your first letter. It was certainly not due to a lack of
interest on mgr part in this project. X believe it to be
extremely important. I look forward to hearing of its progress.
If there is anything that X can do, plaase feel free to write.
There will be no similar delay the next time.
Sincerely,
Sam L. Becker
Director, Division of
Television-Radio-Film
